intro: Faramea stenura, commonly known as the narrow-leaved faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short peduncles. Faramea stenura is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
